questiontext.text:
Exercise

Compute the improper integral. If it convergent evaluate it, otherwise enter the value none as your answer. \[ I = \int_{{@alaraja@}}^{{@ylaraja@}} \textrm{e}^{-x} {@b@} \, \textrm{d}x. \] \( I = \) [[input:SAns]][[validation:SAns]]

Give your answer in exact form.

generalfeedback.text:
We have the integral: \[ I = \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} {{@b@}} \, \textrm{d}x.\] We can use integration by parts: \(\displaystyle\int_a^{b} u(x)v'(x) \, \textrm{d}x = [u(x)v(x)]_a^b -\int_{a}^{b} u'(x)v(x) \, \textrm{d}x\)

We have: \(u(x)=\textrm{e}^{-x} \Rightarrow u'(x)=-\textrm{e}^{-x}\) and \(v'(x)= {@b@} \Rightarrow v(x)= -\frac{1}{{@a@}} \cos({{@a@}}x)\)


So our integral becomse: \begin{eqnarray*} I = \int_{{@alaraja@}}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} {{@b@}} \, \textrm{d}x & = & \bigg/_{\!\!\!\!0}^{\,\infty} -\textrm{e}^{-x} \cdot \frac{1}{{@a@}} \cdot \cos({@a@}x)-\int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \cdot \frac{1}{{@a@}}\cos({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x \\ & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}}-\frac{1}{{@a@}} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \cos({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x \end{eqnarray*}

Applying integration by parts again, we get:

\(u(x)=\textrm{e}^{-x} \Rightarrow u'(x)=-\textrm{e}^{-x} \) and

\(v'(x)= \cos({@a@}x) \Rightarrow v(x)=\frac{1}{{@a@}} \sin({@a@}x)\)

So our initial integral becomes:

\begin{eqnarray*} I = \frac{1}{{@a@}}-\frac{1}{{@a@}} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \cos({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}}-\frac{1}{{@a@}} \bigg(\bigg/_{\!\!\!\!0}^{\,\infty} \frac{1}{{@a@}} \textrm{e}^{-x} \sin({@a@}x)-\int_{0}^{\infty} -\textrm{e}^{-x}\cdot \frac{1}{{@a@}} \sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x \bigg) \\ & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}}-\frac{1}{{@a@}} \bigg( 0+ \frac{1}{{@a@}} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \sin({{@a@}}x) \, \textrm{d}x \bigg) \\ & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}}-\frac{1}{{@aa@}}\int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x. \end{eqnarray*} Whoa! The original integrand appeared also on the right hand side of the equation! Let us move it to the left side. \begin{eqnarray*} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x}\sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x+\frac{1}{{@aa@}} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x}\sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}} \\ {@dd@} \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x & = & \frac{1}{{@a@}} \\ \int_{0}^{\infty} \textrm{e}^{-x} \sin({@a@}x) \, \textrm{d}x & = & {@TAns@}. \end{eqnarray*}
